evidence.abstract_thinking: Prefers concrete instructions and practical tasks; avoids theoretical or philosophical discussions.
evidence.systems_thinking: Frequently maps out workflows and dependencies before starting projects.
evidence.novelty_seeking: Prefers sticking to familiar tools and routines rather than experimenting.
evidence.detail_orientation: Points out small inconsistencies and corrects minor errors in documents.
evidence.decisiveness: Sometimes delays decisions to gather more data.
evidence.pattern_recognition: Quickly identifies recurring issues across different projects.
evidence.risk_tolerance: Comfortable making high-stakes decisions when data supports it.
evidence.contrarianism: Challenges popular opinions in meetings and pushes alternative strategies.
evidence.depth_vs_breadth: Dives deeply into one domain rather than juggling many interests.
evidence.emotional_expressiveness: Communication is brief and emotionally neutral.
evidence.hotheadedness: Shows visible frustration when standards are not met.
evidence.empathy_signaling: Focuses on solutions rather than emotional validation.
evidence.self_criticism: Rarely questions own competence; projects steady self-assurance.
evidence.confidence_oscillation: Maintains a consistent tone and stance across situations.
evidence.optimism: Temperate and realistic outlook; avoids overly positive framing.
evidence.vulnerability: Does not openly share personal fears or insecurities.
evidence.emotional_neediness: Does not seek reassurance or validation from others.
evidence.intensity: Works steadily without dramatic swings in enthusiasm.
evidence.frustration_tolerance: Remains composed during setbacks and tight timelines.
evidence.leadership_drive: Volunteers to coordinate teams and set direction.
evidence.structure_need: Creates detailed plans, checklists, and schedules.
evidence.feedback_receptivity: Listens to feedback but defends original approach when justified.
evidence.execution_bias: Quickly moves from planning to implementation.
evidence.async_preference: Prefers written updates and documented processes over live discussion.
evidence.ownership_taking: Takes responsibility for outcomes and follows through personally.
evidence.perfectionism: Revises work multiple times to meet high internal standards.
evidence.collaboration_enjoyment: Collaborates when necessary but prefers independent work.
evidence.adaptability: Adjusts plans efficiently when constraints change.
evidence.deadline_orientation: Tracks milestones carefully and pushes to deliver early.
evidence.intrinsic_motivation: Derives satisfaction from solving complex operational problems.
evidence.impact_orientation: Frames goals around measurable organizational outcomes.
evidence.ambition: Actively pursues promotions and larger scopes of responsibility.
evidence.ethical_sensitivity: Raises concerns when processes seem unfair or non-compliant.
evidence.loyalty: Supports team objectives but prioritizes mission over individuals.
evidence.intellectual_humility: Confident in expertise and rarely defers without strong evidence.
evidence.long_term_thinking: Plans initiatives with multi-year horizons in mind.
evidence.verbosity: Keeps messages short and to the point.
evidence.humor_frequency: Rarely uses jokes in professional settings.
evidence.question_asking_rate: Asks questions only when clarification is strictly necessary.
evidence.formality: Uses formal greetings and structured language.
evidence.storytelling_tendency: Avoids anecdotes; focuses on facts and metrics.
evidence.social_energy: Limits social interaction to necessary collaboration.
evidence.routine_vs_spontaneity: Prefers predictable schedules and pre-planned activities.
evidence.creative_drive: Focuses more on optimization than original creation.
evidence.physical_lifestyle: Maintains consistent workout and sleep routines.
evidence.life_pace: Operates at a steady, disciplined rhythm.
